title: File upload XSS (Java applet) on http://slackatwork.com/

profile.name: Slack
profile.about: All your team communication in one place, instantly searchable, and available wherever you go.

vulnerability_information:
The web application supports file uploads and I was able to upload a Java Applet (.class/.jar) file. If a web browser loads a Java applet from a trusted site, the browser provides no security warning. If an attacker can upload a CLASS/JAR file with an applet, the file is executed even if the web page, which embeds the applet is located on a different site. An attacker could use a file upload function to build an XSS attack using active content.

The impact of this vulnerability
Malicious users may inject JavaScript, VBScript, ActiveX, HTML or Flash into a vulnerable application to fool a user in order to gather data from them. An attacker can steal the session cookie and take over the account, impersonating the user. It is also possible to modify the content of the page presented to the user.


Here is the link of the file i was able to upload with class extension:-

Successfully uploaded file Applet3863.class with content type image/jpeg.

The file is available at: http://slackatwork.com/wp-content/uploads/job-manager-uploads/company_logo/2015/11/Applet3863.class.

activities.message:
Thank you for your report.

The fact that this site allows unrestricted file uploads is not, in and of itself, a security vulnerability.  Furthermore, this site is public and unauthenticated, so there doesn't appear to be any private information to obtain using such a vulnerability.  Can you explain exactly what security risk you feel is posed by this behavior and exactly how this can be exploited?

Thanks, and good luck with your future bug hunting.

activities.message:
Hi @bugtriage  thank you for your response, the vulnerability present here is that an attacker can use a slack domain to target people, an attacker can simply upload a malware or virus with CLASS/JAR extension on this domain, and use link to spread it, even an attacker can use this link against slack customers as it is a slack domain many people will believe its a legitimate thing they are downloading or installing. 

Or 

An attacker can design a malicious persistent XSS script and upload it here , again he will be able to target Slack users and steal there credential information or other sensitive information. Again this will be easy for him to target users as he will be doing this from a domain which belongs to slack. 

Regards
